StringUtility Class Reference

Some useful string functions. More...

#include <StringUtility.h>

List of all members.

    Converts the name string into close ident for use in SearchModule.

    Compare two strings.

    Compare two strings ignoring case.

    Compare the n first letters in two strings, ignoring case.

    Locate a substring.
  • char * strchr (const char *s, int c)
    Locate a character in a string.
  • char * strrchr (const char *s, int c)
    Locate the last occurrence character in a string.
  • void trimEnd (char *s, const char *additional="")
    Removes whitespace at the end of the string given as parameter, can also remove other characters at the end.
  • char * trimStart (const char *s, const char *additional="")
    Search for the first character in a string that is not whitespace (or optionally additional characters).
  • MC2String trimStartEnd (const char *s, const char *additional="")
    Trims start and end of the string.
  • MC2String trimStartEnd (const MC2String &orig, const char *additional="")
    Trims start and end of the string.
  • MC2String & trimStartInPlace (MC2String &str)
    Trims whitespace from the beginning of a string.
  • MC2String & trimEndInPlace (MC2String &str)
    Trims whitespace from the end of a string.
  • MC2String & trimInPlace (MC2String &str)
    Trims whitespace from both the beginning and the end of a string.
  • MC2String makeFirstCapital (const MC2String &str)
    Makes the first char in str uppercase.
  • MC2String makeFirstInWordCapital (const MC2String &str, bool makeRomanNumbersUpper=false)
    Make the first character in every word uppercase, and all other characters lowercase.
  • int isRomanNumeral (const char *str, uint32 n)
  • void makeRomanNumeralsUpper (char *str)
  • char * newStrDup (const char *s)
    Allocates memory for, and copies a string using new instead of malloc (that the normal strdup uses).
  • char * strsep (char **stringp, const char *delim)
    Does the exact same thing as the strsep() that can be found in for instance Linux, but is missing in Solaris.
  • void tokenListToVector (vector< char * > &out, char *list, char sep, bool skipEmptyTokens=true, bool trimStart=true)
    Turns a token separated string into a vector of strings.
  • void tokenListToVector (vector< MC2String > &splitStr, const MC2String &toSplit, char sep, bool skipEmptyTokens=true, bool trimStart=true)
  • void splitToVector (const MC2String &toSplit, char separator, vector< MC2String > &splitStr, bool skipEmptyTookens=true)
    Turns a token separated string into a vector of strings.
  • template<class OutIt> void strtok (const MC2String &s, const MC2String &delim, OutIt out)
    Sort of a MC2String and STL version of strtok, only without most of strtoks problems.
  • bool onlyDigitsInString (const char *str, bool ignoreSpace=false)
    Check if a given string only contains digits.
  • bool containsDigit (const char *str)
    Returns true if the string contains one or more digits.
  • int replaceChar (char *str, char searchFor, char replaceWith, int stopAt=int32(0x7fffffff))
    Replaces chars by other chars.

    Replaces strings in strings.

    Checks if a character is alphanumerical (all characters above 127 are considered alphanumerical).

    Converts a SQLdate to Unix time.
  • int makeDateStr (uint32 time, char *dateStr, char *timeStr)
    Makes a date and time string from a time value.

    Format a time string according to fmt, see man strftime for all format strings.
  • uint32 convertDate (uint32 year, uint32 month, uint32 day)
    Obsolete! Use TimeUtility::convertDate.
  • char * strlcat (char *dest, const char *src, size_t n)
    Safer method of using strncat, inspired by Secure-Programs-HOWTO.
  • char * strlcpy (char *dest, const char *src, size_t n)
    USE utf8lcpy IF UTF-8 is used.

    Prints random chars into target for nbr chars.

    WAPifies str into target.

    Converts a string with swedish characters to english by removing the "dots" and "rings".

Detailed Description

Some useful string functions.

int StringUtility::base64Decode (  const char *  input,
byte *  output
)  [static]
 

Base 64 decode a string.

Is NOT optimized.

Parameters:
input The string to decode.
output The bytearray to write the decoded chars to. Base64decoding takes 1/4 less chars than there are chars in the input string. The bytearray is nullterminated.
Returns:
The length if the string decoded ok, -1 if faulty Base64 input.

bool StringUtility::base64Encode (  const byte *  input,
uint32  inputLength,
char *  output,
uint32  maxLineLength = uint32(0xffffffffU)
)  [static]
 

Base 64 encodes a buffer.

Is NOT optimized.

Parameters:
input The buffer to encode.
inputLength The size of the input buffer.
output The string to write the encoded chars to. Base64encoding takes 1/3 + 4 more chars than there are chars in the input string. If you use maxLineLength then there is (inputLength / maxLineLength) * 2 more chars.
maxLineLength The maximun length before breaking a line with carrige return and line feed.
Returns:
True, there are no faulty inputs that can be detected by this method.

MC2String StringUtility::base64Encode (  const MC2String &  instr,
uint32  maxLineLength = uint32(0xffffffffU)
)  [static]
 

Base 64 encodes a string.

Is NOT optimized.

Parameters:
instr The input string
Returns:
The input string base64 encoded.

bool StringUtility::base64Encode (  const char *  input,
char *  output,
uint32  maxLineLength = uint32(0xffffffffU)
)  [static]
 

Base 64 encodes a string.

Is NOT optimized.

Parameters:
input The string to encode.
output The string to write the encoded chars to. Base64encoding takes 4/3 + 4 more chars than there are chars in the input string. If you use maxLineLength then there is (inputLength * 4/3 / maxLineLength) * 2 more chars.
maxLineLength The maximun length before breaking a line with carrige return and line feed.
Returns:
True, there are no faulty strings that can be detected by this method.

bool StringUtility::checkBoolean (  const char *  str,
bool  defaultValue = false
)  [static]
 

Checks if a string is "true" or "false" and retuns true or false.

If string isn't "true" or "false" then default is returned.

Parameters:
str The string to check for boolean.
defaultValue The default value if str is not recognized as a boolean. Default false.

MC2String StringUtility::copyLower (  mc2TextIterator  str  )  [inline, static]
 

Makes a lowercase copy of str and returns it.

The iterator is automatically created from e.g. const char* or MC2String, so please do not do any casts or temporary variables.

Parameters:
str is the string to copy and to lowercase.
Returns:
the new lowercase string.

const char *  endStr,
bool  caseSensitive = false
)  [static]
 

Checks if a string ends with a certain string.

All strings must be null-terminated.

Parameters:
str The string to check.
endStr The end-string to check for.
caseSensitive Whether the comparison should be case sensitive or not. Default not case sensitive.
Returns:
True if str ends with endStr, otherwise false.

int StringUtility::makeDateStr (  uint32  time,
char *  dateStr,
char *  timeStr
)  [static]
 

Makes a date and time string from a time value.

dateStr must be of a length of 11 and timeStr 9.

Parameters:
time The time in UTC.
dateStr The string to print date into.
timeStr The string to print time into.
Returns:
The number of chars written to timeStr.

Returns:

MC2String StringUtility::makeFirstInWordCapital (  const MC2String &  str,
bool  makeRomanNumbersUpper = false
)  [static]
 

Make the first character in every word uppercase, and all other characters lowercase.

WARNING! Is not really UTF-8 aware. Only works because X, I and V are ascii.

Parameters:
str The string where to change case.
makeRomanNumbersUpper True if roman numerals (e.g. "XI" or "IV") should be written with upper case letters.
Returns:
A pointer to str.

void StringUtility::makeRomanNumeralsUpper (  char *  str  )  [static]
 

char * StringUtility::newStrDup (  const char *  s  )  [inline, static]
 

Allocates memory for, and copies a string using new instead of malloc (that the normal strdup uses).

The copied string may be deleted using delete instead of free.

Parameters:
s The string to copy.
Returns:
A copy of s.

int StringUtility::null_strcmp (  const char *  string1,
const char *  string2
)  [inline, static]
 

Compares two strings, one or both of which may be NULL.

Using StringUtility::strcasecmp. (case insensitive)

Parameters:
string1 The first string.
string2 The second string.
Returns:
The result of strcasecmp, or similar if strings are NULL.

)  [static]
 

Match a string using a regular expression with substrings.

See man regexec for cflags and eflags.

Parameters:
regex The regular expression.
string The string to match.
nbrMatches The number of substring in regex.
matches The substrings are added to this.
cflags See man regcomp.
eflags See man regexec.
Returns:
True if matching, false if not.

const char *  string,
int  cflags = REG_EXTENDED,
int  eflags = 0
)  [static]
 

Match a string using a regular expression.

See man regexec for cflags and eflags. REG_NOSUB is always set in cflags.

Parameters:
regex The regular expression.
string The string to match.
cflags See man regcomp.
eflags See man regexec.
Returns:
True if matching, false if not.

bool StringUtility::regexpWholeBracket (  const MC2String &  regex,
const MC2String &  string,
int  cflags = REG_EXTENDED,
int  eflags = 0
)  [static]
 

bool StringUtility::regexpWholeBracket (  const char *  regex,
const char *  string,
int  cflags = REG_EXTENDED,
int  eflags = 0
)  [static]
 

Match a string using a regular expression with a bracket expression around it and checks if the whole string was matched.

Like "([a]+)" Matches any non empty string with only 'a's in it. See man regexec for cflags and eflags.

Parameters:
regex The regular expression, surounded by ().
string The string to match.
cflags See man regcomp.
eflags See man regexec.
Returns:
True if matching, false if not.

char* StringUtility::removeAllButDigits (  const char *  str  )  [static]
 

Removes all non digit chars from str and returns a copy with only the digits.

Parameters:
str The string to extract digits from.
Returns:
A new string with the digits from str, caller must delete it.

int StringUtility::replaceChar (  char *  str,
char  searchFor,
char  replaceWith,
int  stopAt = int32(0x7fffffff)
)  [static]
 

Replaces chars by other chars.

Parameters:
str the string to change
searchFor the char to replace
replaceWith the char to replace the searchFor chars with.
stopAt The number of characters to check.

char* StringUtility::replaceString (  const char *  source,
const char *  searchFor,
const char *  replaceWith,
int  maxReplace = 0
)  [static]
 

Replaces strings in strings.

A new string or NULL is returned, the original string is not deleted, the caller has to delete the new string when done.

Parameters:
source The original string
searchFor The string to replace
replaceWith The string to replace with. Can be NULL or just "".
maxReplace The maximum number of strings to replace, 0 means replace all ocurrences (also default).
Returns:
Pointer to a new string with all replacements done, NULL if no replacements were made;
NOTE: This method is used in both MC2 and Nav2. * Please change both if bugs are found.

char* StringUtility::splitSeconds (  uint32  deltaTime,
char *  str
)  [static]
 

Prints one delta time (in seconds) into a preallocated string.

Calls splitSeconds internally.

Parameters:
deltaTime The time difference to print (in s).
str The string where the result should be written.
Returns:
A pointer to str.

bool StringUtility::splitSeconds (  uint32  deltaTime,
uint32 &  hour,
uint32 &  minute,
uint32 &  second
)  [static]
 

Translate a timedifferance in seconds to hours, minutes and seconds.

Parameters:
deltaTime The time differance in seconds.
hour Outparamter that is set to the number of hours in deltatime.
minute Outparamter that is set to the number of minutes (0-59) in deltatime.
second Outparamter that is set to the number of seconds (0-59) in deltatime.
Returns:
True if caluculation when alright, false otherwise.

void StringUtility::splitToVector (  const MC2String &  toSplit,
char  separator,
vector< MC2String > &  splitStr,
bool  skipEmptyTookens = true
)  [static]
 

Turns a token separated string into a vector of strings.

Uses boost::escaped_list_separator Escape character \ and quote character " can be used. http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_32_0/libs/tokenizer/escaped_list_separator.htm

Parameters:
toSplit The string to split
separator The separator used when splitting
splitStr Vector containing the splitted strings
skipEmptyTokens if false, the empty string is a valid token

Referenced by Path::Impl::createStringMatrix().

MC2String StringUtility::SQLEscape (  const MC2String &  src  )  [static]
 

See also:
SQLEscape(char*)

char* StringUtility::SQLEscape (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
uint32  max = uint32(0xffffffffU),
uint32  len = 0
)  [static]
 

"SQL" escapes a string, adds the result to a string.

Escaped characters: ' "
\

Parameters:
sre Pointer to string to add/escape
dest Pointer to the destination, the escaped string is added and then NULL terminated. Destination needs enough space to fit strlen(source) * 2 + 1 (worst case)
max Maximum characters to add/escape, regardless of the length, default is no limit.
len Length of string, any is then handled as part of the string. Set to 0 to use the null termination in source instead.
Returns:
Pointer to the dest string.

MC2String StringUtility::SQLEscapeSecure (  const MC2String &  src  )  [static]
 

See also:
SQLEscapeSecure(char*)

char* StringUtility::SQLEscapeSecure (  const char *  src,
char *  dest,
uint32  max = uint32(0xffffffffU),
uint32  len = 0
)  [static]
 

"SQL" escapes a string, like SQLEscape, but escapes additional potentially "dangerous charactes.

The full set escaped: ' "
\ _

Parameters:
src Pointer to string to add/escape
dest Pointer to the destination, the escaped string is added and then NULL terminated. Destination needs enough space to fit strlen(source) * 2 + 1 (worst case)
max Maximum characters to add/escape, regardless of the length, default is no limit.
len Length of string, any is then handled as part of the string. Set to 0 to use the null termination in source instead.
Returns:
Pointer to the dest string.

int StringUtility::strcasecmp (  const mc2TextIterator &  strA,
const mc2TextIterator &  strB
)  [inline, static]
 

Compare two strings ignoring case.

Works like the system call strcasecmp, but this also works with swedish characters! Sorts, does not collate!

Parameters:
strA The first string to compare.
strB The second string to compare.
Returns:
An integer less than 0 if strA < strB, 0 if strA == strB and an integer > 0 if strA > strB.

Compare the n first letters in two strings, ignoring case.

Works like the system call strncasecmp, but this also works with swedish characters!

Parameters:
strA The first string to compare.
strB The second string to compare.
n The maximum number of characters to compare.
Returns:
An integer
  • less than 0 if (the first n letters of) strA < strB
  • equal to 0 if strA == strB
  • greater than 0 if strA > strB.

char* StringUtility::strsep (  char **  stringp,
const char *  delim
)  [static]
 

Does the exact same thing as the strsep() that can be found in for instance Linux, but is missing in Solaris.

It returns the next token from the string stringp which is delimited by a character in delim. The token is terminated with a '' character and stringp is updated to point past the token.

Parameters:
stringp Pointer to a pointer the string to tokenize
delim Pointer to string containing the delimiting character(s)
Returns:
Pointer to the next token or NULL if delim isn't found.

template<class OutIt>
void StringUtility::strtok (  const MC2String &  s,
const MC2String &  delim,
OutIt  out
)  [inline, static]
 

Sort of a MC2String and STL version of strtok, only without most of strtoks problems.

Most importantly it is reentrant and doesn't modify its first argument. It still has the drawback that you loose the identity of the delimiting character.

If s is the empty string, no tokens are generated.

If s contains two adjacent delimiter characters an empty string token will be generated for the string between them.

If s has delimiters at the beginning or end, empty string tokens will be generated.

As a result of the above rules, if s contains only a single delimiter character, two empty string tokens will be generated.

Parameters:
s The string to tokenize.
delim Lists the delimiters.
out Output iterator for storing the tokens. Use back_inserter to insert elements into containers.

Definition at line 367 of file StringUtility.h.

References MC2String::find_first_of(), and MC2String::substr().

const char *  pszSource
)  [static]
 

Converts a string with swedish characters to english by removing the "dots" and "rings".

This is handy when creating files where the filename has swedish characters in it.

Parameters:
pszTarget The resulting string without swedish chars.
pszSource The string containing swedish chars.

void StringUtility::tokenListToVector (  vector< MC2String > &  splitStr,
const MC2String &  toSplit,
char  sep,
bool  skipEmptyTokens = true,
bool  trimStart = true
)  [static]
 

See also:
tokenListToVector Probably not very efficient.

void StringUtility::tokenListToVector (  vector< char * > &  out,
char *  list,
char  sep,
bool  skipEmptyTokens = true,
bool  trimStart = true
)  [static]
 

Turns a token separated string into a vector of strings.

Only the vector should be deleted. (not any of the elements.) The list is altered to have ''s where there where seps. The list should be deleted after deleting the vector.

Parameters:
out A vector that will be filled with tokens.
list is the list of items with sep separated words.
sep is the separator.
skipEmptyTokens if false, the empty string is a valid token
trimStart If true, the tokens will be trimmed.
Returns:
a char vector pointing into list.

MC2String & StringUtility::trimEndInPlace (  MC2String &  str  )  [inline, static]
 

Trims whitespace from the end of a string.

Whitespace are all characters identified by the isspace function: space, form-feed (''), newline ('
'), carriage return (''), horizontal tab (''), and vertical tab ('').

Parameters:
str The string to trim. Note that the argument is a reference and is modified by the function.
Returns:
The str argument.

)  [static]

Each input char can result in three output chars.
